Posts.Title: I'm still stable! ElaineD MJLToday

Posts.Content: camdenandmo wrote: I had scans last week.  My doctor said I had significant improvement in my liver and in my bones.  But my Tumor Markers have remained virtually the same since January.  They are still elevated, but only 10% of what they were in October!   My PET/CT in January showed the same results.  I am now wondering if they compared this scan to my initial scan or the CT I had when I had my liver biopsy in November.    A little back story.   At diagnosis, I couldn't be seen by an oncologist at Sloan-Kettering until late October.  So I began seeing an oncologist at another hospital.  I loved him, but I had some big problems with his hospital, disorganization and lack of communications, and the outside facilities they used.  I was just getting extremely stressed anytime I went to an appointment. And I knew I did not want to receive chemo at his hospital when that time came.  I decided that it was easier to change now. One of the problems was that we could not get the information we were requesting sent to Sloan-Kettering.   So I am now wondering if Sloan Kettering even had my January scan results.  I think I am going to email the nurse and see.  Either way, at best, I have had some more regression and, at worst, I've been stable for 6 months.   I am pleased, and know that this is good news.  I was hoping to be closer to NED.  I knew I wouldn't be NED, because there is still a little bit of the primary tumor remaining.  But I really wanted my markers to be getting close to the normal range.  I was surprised to see they were the same, because the nurse at my previous doctor told me they had dropped again in March. I had an oophorectomy a week and a half ago and I am going to have Zometa every other month.  I hope these give me a little boost.  But Tamoxifen does seem to be working. Stacie  Dx 9/23/2008, IDC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Scan Results camdenandmo Alpal

Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2010 03:39PM camdenandmo wrote: I was on Tamoxifen for 1 year, I had a good initial response and remained stable. Around the year mark, I had increased activity and I switched to Femara.  On Femara,  my liver is 'normal' with no evidence of any disease and my bones are healing.  When Femara stops working, I will gladly switch to another hormonal.

Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2009 02:41PM camdenandmo wrote: Hi, Maddy. I am stage IV from the beginning.  I was diagnosed September 2008 at 33.  I would not worry about how high your tumor markers are.  Markers are tricky and generally specific to the individual.  They don't move for some and for others they are absolute.  Also, from what I understand, the numbers aren't necessarily indicitive of how much cancer is in your body. Someone might have the same amount of cancer at 300 or 3000.   A rule of thumb I have heard is don't be concerned about an increase of less than 10%.  Also, since your oncologist is taking two markers, I would be more concerned if they were both moving up than if they move in different directions.  Stacie
Posts.Title: Stage IV on Day One- so filled with fear MaddyMason MaddyMason

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2009 04:23PM camdenandmo wrote: Ugh! Rant on!   Aside from my femara (and previously tamoxifen), I take nothing.  When I had my ooph on in May, right before the surgery, the resident wrote me a prescription for Tylenol 3.  I laughed out loud. I was having my ovaries and a grapefruit sized cyst removed.  The way he looked at me made me feel like a strung out drug seeker, and I took the prescription.  I was so mad.  When the surgeon checked on me after recovery, she tried to talk me into staying overnight.  I told my husband I did not need to stay in the hospital if they only thought I was going to have Tylenol 3 type of pain.   I actually was so angry with the experience (for more than that) that I even changed oncologist.  I wanted nothing to do with that hospital any longer.
Posts.Title: Waah! I had a meltdown. I don't care who posts! Watson konakat

Posts.Content: camdenandmo wrote:  Hi, everyone.    I had a PET/CT on Monday, my first since I began treatment.  I began taking Tamoxifen on September 30, 2008 and had my Zoladex injection on October 1.  They did not remove the lump.  I was pretty sure the scan would be good, because the original lump had shrunk so much and my tumor markers had dropped significantly.  Anyway, my doctor said that the tumor in my liver was 70% smaller than in the PET/CT I had September 27!  And he said my bones were healing nicely! He said I was having a 'textbook' response to the treatment.    Thank you all for being here and letting me share my news.   Stacie  Dx 9/23/2008, IDC, Stage IV, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
